ca.tirtech.etchpad.drawingView

Class DrawingLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.databinding.BaseObservable
      • ca.tirtech.etchpad.mvvm.LiveDataObservable
        • ca.tirtech.etchpad.drawingView.DrawingLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    androidx.databinding.Observable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetworkedDrawingLayer

    public class DrawingLayer
extends LiveDataObservable
    Stores a collection of colored paths. Paths are drawn by traversing from the starting location of the layer to another point or offset. The layer can be drawn on a canvas by calling draw(Canvas).

    DrawingLayers may be created from JSON. The JSON may be generated using jsonify() on an existing object and can be loaded using the appropriate constructor, or may be used to replace an existing layer using objectify(JSONObject), though this is discouraged.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  DrawingLayer.LayerPath
      A container for settings defining a Path with a color and current position (head).

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawingLayer

        public DrawingLayer(float width,
                    float height)
        Construct a blank layer. The pen on this layer will start at the provided (x,y) position.
        Parameters:
        width - starting x pos
        height - starting y pos

      • DrawingLayer

        public DrawingLayer(JSONObject root)
             throws JSONException
        Creates a new drawing layer from the given JSON. This is a convenience constructor, replacing the following:

        DrawingLayer layer = new DrawingLayer(0,0);<br/> layer.{@link #objectify(JSONObject)};
        Parameters:
        root - the JSON to load from
        Throws:
        JSONException - JSON was invalid

        public DrawingLayer.LayerPath getCurrentLayerPath()

        the top-most layer path

      • jsonify

        public JSONObject jsonify()
                   throws JSONException
        Convert this DrawingLayer into a JSONObject. To recreate this object, use objectify(JSONObject).
        Returns:
        the JSON representation of this object
        Throws:
        JSONException - thrown if instance values were not valid JSON types

      • objectify

        public void objectify(JSONObject root)
               throws JSONException
        Load the given JSONObject into this DrawingLayer. JSON should conform to the output of jsonify().
        Parameters:
        root - the JSON to load from
        Throws:
        JSONException - thrown if loaded data was not valid JSON

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Assign the color when drawing on this layer. This will create a new Paint for this color. Since each path must have its own paint, this will create a new path.
        Parameters:
        color - the color to set to
